node.title: Destiny Church's Brian Tamaki bailed again after denying Covid-19 breaches
node.description: Destiny Church leader Brian Tamaki has been granted bail for the third time after pleading not guilty to breaching Covid-19 restrictions.
node.content:
["Destiny Church leader Brian Tamaki has been granted bail for the third time after pleading not guilty to breaching Covid-19 restrictions.", "", "
Photo: RNZ / Marika Khabazi
", "He faced charges in the Auckland District Court over his attendance at an anti-lockdown and anti-mandate protest at Auckland Domain on Saturday.", "He faces tighter bail conditions, including not going to the Auckland Domain at all until a further order of the court.", "He cannot organise, attend, support or speak at a protest which is likely to breach Covid-19 orders.", "Hannah Tamaki has also been charged with two counts of Failing to Comply with Order (Covid-19).", "Earlier this afternoon she was released on bail to appear in court at a later stage.", "It is the third time Brian Tamaki has been charged over speaking at anti-lockdown and anti-mandate protests at Auckland Domain.", "His bail conditions included that he not attend a similar gathering, but on Saturday he spoke at one.", "He addressed a small crowd of supporters outside the Auckland Central police station this morning.", "The Freedoms and Rights Coalition, which is connected to the church, had earlier claimed that Tamaki and his wife Hannah Tamaki had been summoned to the station.", "Outside the station, he made unsupported claims about freedom of association, vaccine data and the social effects of the pandemic.", "", "
Photo: RNZ / Marika Khabazi
", "Brian Tamaki told the crowd neither he nor his wife had received the Pfizer vaccine.", "The couple, who have been prominent at anti-lockdown protests, then went into the station.", "Police say the pair were charged this morning after they were arrested in relation to the Auckland Domain gathering on Saturday which breached alert level restrictions.", "Superintendent Shanan Gray, relieving Auckland City District Commander said police have not ruled out further arrests being made in relation to Saturday's event."]
